page.title: 03Easington Colliery
page.content: The colliery is the most important place of work in Easington. The sinking to the shaft was started in 1899. Coal was first brought to the surface in 1910 and by 1929 output had reached one million tonnes per year. Over the years the colliery has produced coal for domestic use, gas, coking, industrial use and power stations. At present the coal is sold mainly for domestic use and power stations. All the coal produced comes from undersea workings. The seams go out for nearly six miles under the North Sea and there are reserves of about 36000000 tonnes. About 5500/6000 tonnes of coal are produced each day and in 1980/1 1407000 tonnes of coal was produces in one year. About 2300 men are employed at the colliery. Many of them live with their families in Easinton Colliery.
